intro: Tapeinidium stenocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruited tapeinidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, palm-like leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
